item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, April 14, 2025 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. A hackable AI assistant using a single SQLite table and a handful of cron jobs (175 points | 37 comments)
2. The Path to Open-Sourcing the DeepSeek Inference Engine (61 points | 2 comments)
3. How to Bike Across the Country (57 points | 23 comments)
4. Scientists: Protein IL-17 fights infection, acts on the brain, inducing anxiety (10 points | 1 comment)
5. DolphinGemma: How Google AI is helping decode dolphin communication (54 points | 11 comments)
6. Hassabis Says Google DeepMind to Support Anthropic's MCP for Gemini and SDK (25 points | 2 comments)
7. Kezurou-Kai #39 (222 points | 17 comments)
8. Meilisearch – search engine API bringing AI-powered hybrid search (53 points | 29 comments)
9. Show HN: Zero-codegen, no-compile TypeScript type inference from Protobufs (5 points | discuss)
10. Omnom: Self-hosted bookmarking with searchable, wysiwyg snapshots [showcase] (83 points | 31 comments)
11. Hacktical C: practical hacker's guide to the C programming language (106 points | 55 comments)
12. Everything wrong with MCP (381 points | 167 comments)
13. Mario Vargas Llosa has died (169 points | 52 comments)
14. Open guide to equity compensation (552 points | 246 comments)
15. Cure ID App Lets Clinicians Report Novel Uses of Existing Drugs (18 points | 7 comments)
16. Dead trees keep surprisingly large amounts of carbon out of atmosphere (37 points | 29 comments)
17. SQLite File Format Viewer (7 points | 3 comments)
18. Show HN: Resurrecting Infocom's Unix Z-Machine with Cosmopolitan (126 points | 36 comments)
19. Show HN: I made a free tool that analyzes SEC filings and posts detailed reports (236 points | 64 comments)
20. New Vulnerability in GitHub Copilot, Cursor: Hackers Can Weaponize Code Agents (159 points | 95 comments)
21. Googler... ex-Googler (740 points | 634 comments)
22. Zig's new LinkedList API (it's time to learn fieldParentPtr) (135 points | 106 comments)
23. Albert Einstein's theory of relativity in words of four letters or less (1999) (205 points | 109 comments)
24. NoProp: Training neural networks without back-propagation or forward-propagation (131 points | 37 comments)
25. Writing Cursor rules with a Cursor rule (131 points | 42 comments)
26. Why Everything in the Universe Turns More Complex (121 points | 75 comments)
27. Implementing DeepSeek R1's GRPO algorithm from scratch (173 points | 3 comments)
28. Transformer Lab (130 points | 14 comments)
29. Why Fennel? (265 points | 122 comments)
30. Neutrinos' maximum possible mass shrinks further (71 points | 27 comments)
